isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 9200 9300 9400 MODELS BUILT AFTER JANUARY 1, 1995 - ELECTRONIC ENGINE CONTROLS - DETROIT DIESEL SERIES 60 - 1992 - 1993 - SYSTEM COMPONENTS AND OPERATION - CRUISE/PTO CONTROL OPERATION

svcprocinfo.para: Refer to the Operator's Manual for operating instructions.

Cruise Control - Cruise control operates when vehicle speed is greater than 35 mph and engine speed is greater than 1200 rpm. Note that the engine speed signal used by the ECM in controlling the cruise system comes from the DDEC sensors. The International installed engine speed sensor inputs to the vehicle tachometer.
PTO Control - The PTO operates when vehicle speed is zero AND the park brake is set, which opens the park brake switch (269). Releasing the park brake disables the PTO controls.
The cruise control and PTO system share the same components which include:

svcsubproc.title: Cruise Control Brake/Clutch Relay (272)
svcsubproc.para: The Cruise Control Brake/Clutch relay is used to enable and disable the cruise and PTO controls.

CRUISE CONTROL MODE - For the cruise control to operate, the Cruise Control Brake/Clutch relay must be energized. Depressing the clutch pedal, applying the service brakes or setting the park brake will cause the relay to de-energize, disabling the cruise control.
PTO CONTROL MODE - The PTO only operates when the Cruise Control Brake/Clutch relay is de-energized by applying the Park Brake.

note.para: The Cruise Control Brake/Clutch Relay is a suppressed relay to prevent voltage spikes from entering the electrical system when the relay is de-energized. ONLY replace this relay with correct part. All relays in the International system are suppressed.

para.emph: Energizing The Cruise Control Brake/Clutch Relay (272)

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 1 for the discussion on energizing relay (272). Ignition power (12V) from the key switch through 20A fuse F3 goes through the clutch switch (with pedal released) and through the service brake switch (service brakes not applied) and through the park brake switch (park brake not set) to the control coil of the cruise control brake/clutch relay, causing it to energize. With the relay energized, the relay contact toggles closing the circuit between 30 and 87, opening the circuit between 30 and 87A.

svcsubproc.title: Cruise/PTO ON/OFF Switch (262)
svcsubproc.para: The Cruise/PTO ON/OFF switch receives an ECM signal on circuit 97AG from the Cruise Control Brake/Clutch Relay (272). The ECM signal will enable either the Cruise Control mode OR the PTO Control mode.

CRUISE CONTROL MODE - With the Cruise Control Brake/Clutch relay energized, the ECM signal is sent through the ECM connector (273), location G2 on circuit 97AR to the relay, then through the normally open contacts (87 to 30) and on circuit 97AG to the Cruise ON/OFF switch. Placing the ON/OFF switch in the ON position completes the circuit to ground indicating to the ECM that the Cruise/PTO Switch is in the ON position.

PTO CONTROL MODE - With the Cruise Control Brake/Clutch relay de-energized, the ECM signal is sent through the ECM connector (273), location J2 on circuit 97AS to the relay, then through the normally closed contacts (87A to 30) and on circuit 97AG to the Cruise/PTO ON/OFF switch. Placing the ON/OFF switch in the ON position completes the circuit to ground indicating to the ECM that the Cruise/PTO ON/OFF Switch is in the ON position.

svcsubproc.title: Momentary Cruise Control Selector Switch
svcsubproc.para: Refer to the Owner's Manual for operational instructions.

The momentary cruise control selector switch receives signals on four circuits from the ECM through connector (273). When the Cruise Control ON/OFF switch is in the ON position, the ground path for these four circuits is through circuit 97AE and the ON/OFF switch to ground.
Placing the selector switch in each of the four positions completes the following circuits:

item.para: With the switch in the SET ON position, the circuit between ECM connector (273), location J1 and ground is complete.
With the switch in the RESUME ON position, the circuit between ECM connector (273), location G3 and ground is complete.
With the switch in the ACCEL position, the circuit between ECM connector (273), location F2 and ground is complete.
With the switch in the COAST position, the circuit between ECM connector (273), location F1 and ground is complete.

svcsubproc.para: Depending upon the enabled mode of operation (Cruise or PTO), the completed circuits will cause the ECM to perform some cruise or PTO function (SET, RESUME etc.)

svcsubproc.title: Vehicle Speed Sensor (250)
svcsubproc.para: The vehicle speed sensor is a dual coil sensor with two leads (two wires in each lead). The speed sensor is located at the rear of the transmission. One speed sensor lead sends a variable alternating current (AC) from engine harness connector (250) on circuits 97AJ and 97AK through ECM connector (273) locations E2 and E3 to the ECM. The other lead sends the same signal through the chassis and cab harness to the speedometer unit, located in the instrument panel.

svcsubproc.title: Clutch Switch (295)
svcsubproc.para: The clutch switch is a normally open switch, adjusted to close when the clutch pedal is in the released position. Depressing the clutch pedal 0.5 inch should cause the switch to open. Clutch switch operation is discussed in Cruise Control Brake/Clutch Relay (272).

svcsubproc.title: Service Brake Switch (277)
svcsubproc.para: The service brake switch is an air actuated switch. It is closed when the service brakes are not applied, and opens when the service brakes are applied. Service brake switch operation is discussed in Cruise Control Brake/Clutch Relay (272).

svcsubproc.title: Park Brake Switch (269)
svcsubproc.para: The park brake switch is an air actuated switch. It is closed with the park brakes released, and opens when the park brakes are set. Switch operation is discussed in Cruise Control Brake/Clutch Relay (272).
